org.deri.tarql

Class CSVOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deri.tarql.CSVOptions

  • public class CSVOptions
extends Object
    Configuration options for describing a CSV file. Also provides convenience functions for creating Readers and CSVParsers based on these options.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Map<String,Character> charNames

      • overrideWith

        public void overrideWith(CSVOptions other)
        Override values in this object with those from the other. Anything that is not explicitly set in the other object will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        other - The instance whose values to take over

      • setDefaultsForCSV

        public void setDefaultsForCSV()

      • setDefaultsForTSV

        public void setDefaultsForTSV()

      • setEncoding

        public void setEncoding(String encoding)
        Specify the CSV file's character encoding. null signifies unknown encoding, that is, auto-detection. The default is null.
        Parameters:
        encoding - The character encoding to set for this value

      • getEncoding

        public String getEncoding()
        Returns the CSV file's character encoding, or null if unknown.
        Returns:
        This instance's value for the character encoding, or null if unknown

      • setColumnNamesInFirstRow

        public void setColumnNamesInFirstRow(Boolean value)
        Set whether the CSV file's first row contains column names. null means unknown. The default is null.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to set

      • hasColumnNamesInFirstRow

        public Boolean hasColumnNamesInFirstRow()
        Set whether the CSV file's first row contains column names. null means unknown. The default is null.
        Returns:
        This instance's value, or null if unknown

      • setDelimiter

        public void setDelimiter(Character delimiter)
        Sets the delimiter between entries. null means unknown.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The delimiter character for this instance

      • getDelimiter

        public Character getDelimiter()
        Gets the delimiter between entries. null means unknown.
        Returns:
        The delimiter character for this instance, or null if unknown

      • setQuoteChar

        public void setQuoteChar(Character quote)
        Sets the quote character used in the file. null means no quote character, and there is no way to escape the delimiter by quoting.
        Parameters:
        quote - The quote character for this instance, or null

      • getQuoteChar

        public Character getQuoteChar()
        Gets the quote character used in the file. null means no quote character, and there is no way to escape the delimiter by quoting.
        Returns:
        The configured quote character, or null if none

      • setEscapeChar

        public void setEscapeChar(Character escape)
        Sets the escape character used in the file to escape quotes. null means no escape character, and quotes inside quoted values are escaped as two quote characters.
        Parameters:
        escape - The escape character for this instance, or null

      • getEscapeChar

        public Character getEscapeChar()
        Gets the escape character used in the file to escape quotes. null means no escape character, and quotes inside quoted values are escaped as two quote characters.
        Returns:
        The configured escape character, or null if none

      • openParserFor

        public CSVParser openParserFor(InputStreamSource source)
                        throws IOException
        Creates a new CSVParser for a given InputStreamSource with the options of this instance.
        Parameters:
        source - The input to read from
        Returns:
        a parser for the source, configured with the options from this instance
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while opening the source

      • openReaderFor

        public Reader openReaderFor(InputStreamSource source)
                     throws IOException
        Creates a new Reader for a given InputStreamSource with the options of this instance.
        Parameters:
        source - The input to read from
        Returns:
        a Reader over the source, using this instance's character encoding
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while opening the source
